Insatiable Cravings, Unholy Desires Transmitted to Young.--Both parents transmit their own characteristics, mental and physical, their dispositions and appetites, to 


                                                   135 

their children....Liquor drinkers and tobacco users may, and do, transmit their insatiable craving, their inflamed blood and irritable nerves, to their children. The licentious often bequeath their unholy desires, and even loathsome diseases, as a legacy to their offspring. And as the children have less power to resist temptation than had the parents, the tendency is for each generation to fall lower and lower.--PP 561 (1890).
